intro: Colomandra, commonly known as the mountain everlasting, is a genus of flowering plants native to Australia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers. The plants typically grow in arid or semi-arid regions, thriving in well-drained soils. Their flowers bloom in shades of yellow, orange, and red, making them a striking addition to native gardens.
